channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GSTran: Joint Geometric and Semantic Coherence for Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: The proposed network mainly consists of two principal components: a local geometric transformer and a global semantic transformer.

item.title: Learning Deep Dissipative Dynamics
item.description: By analytically proving the general solution to the nonlinear Kalman-Yakubovich-Popov (KYP) lemma, which is the necessary and sufficient condition for dissipativity, we propose a differentiable projection that transforms any dynamics represented by neural networks into dissipative ones and a learning method for the transformed dynamics.

item.title: Embedding Ordinality to Binary Loss Function for Improving Solar Flare Forecasting
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel loss function aimed at optimizing the binary flare prediction problem by embedding the intrinsic ordinal flare characteristics into the binary cross-entropy (BCE) loss function.

item.title: Improving Out-of-Distribution Data Handling and Corruption Resistance via Modern Hopfield Networks
item.description: Additionally, we investigate the capability of MHN to converge to the original non-corrupted data.

item.title: Classification of Mitral Regurgitation from Cardiac Cine MRI using Clinically-Interpretable Morphological Features
item.description: We propose a new approach to identify MR which automatically extracts 4-dimensional (3D + Time) morphological features from the reconstructed mitral annulus (MA) using Cine long-axis (LAX) views MRI.

item.title: Unlocking Adversarial Suffix Optimization Without Affirmative Phrases: Efficient Black-box Jailbreaking via LLM as Optimizer
item.description: Moreover, ECLIPSE is on par with template-based methods in ASR while offering superior attack efficiency, reducing the average attack overhead by 83%.

item.title: Optimizing Interpretable Decision Tree Policies for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We empirically show that DTPO is a competitive algorithm compared to imitation learning algorithms for optimizing decision tree policies in reinforcement learning.

item.title: UniFashion: A Unified Vision-Language Model for Multimodal Fashion Retrieval and Generation
item.description: In this work, we present UniFashion, a unified framework that simultaneously tackles the challenges of multimodal generation and retrieval tasks within the fashion domain, integrating image generation with retrieval tasks and text generation tasks.

item.title: Critique-out-Loud Reward Models
item.description: To enable reward models to reason explicitly about the quality of a response, we introduce Critique-out-Loud (CLoud) reward models.

item.title: Estimated Audio-Caption Correspondences Improve Language-Based Audio Retrieval
item.description: We evaluate our method on the ClothoV2 and the AudioCaps benchmark and show that it improves retrieval performance, even in a restricting self-distillation setting where a single model generates and then learns from the estimated correspondences.

item.title: Oh, Behave! Country Representation Dynamics Created by Feedback Loops in Music Recommender Systems
item.description: In addition, users from less represented countries (e. g., Finland) are, in the long term, most affected by the under-representation of their local music in recommendations.

item.title: CHOTA: A Higher Order Accuracy Metric for Cell Tracking
item.description: We show that CHOTA is sensitive to all tracking errors and gives a good indication of the biologically relevant capability of a method to reconstruct the full lineage of cells.

item.title: NuSegDG: Integration of Heterogeneous Space and Gaussian Kernel for Domain-Generalized Nuclei Segmentation
item.description: To alleviate the labor-intensive requirement of manual prompts, we introduce a Gaussian-Kernel Prompt Encoder (GKP-Encoder) to generate density maps driven by a single point, which guides segmentation predictions by mixing position prompts and semantic prompts.

item.title: Differentiating Choices via Commonality for Multiple-Choice Question Answering
item.description: Our model captures token-level attention of each choice to the question, and separates tokens of the question attended to by all the choices (i. e., commonalities) from those by individual choices (i. e., nuances).

item.title: OAPT: Offset-Aware Partition Transformer for Double JPEG Artifacts Removal
item.description: Specifically, the predictor estimates pixel offsets between the first and second compression, which are then utilized to divide different patterns.

item.title: Persistent Homology via Ellipsoids
item.description: This complex is based on the idea that ellipsoids aligned with tangent directions better approximate the data compared to conventional (Euclidean) balls centered at sample points that are used in the construction of Rips and Alpha complexes, for instance.

item.title: E-Bench: Subjective-Aligned Benchmark Suite for Text-Driven Video Editing Quality Assessment
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, E-Bench introduces the first quality assessment dataset for video editing and an effective subjective-aligned quantitative metric for this domain.

item.title: TWLV-I: Analysis and Insights from Holistic Evaluation on Video Foundation Models
item.description: Based on the average top-1 accuracy of linear probing on five action recognition benchmarks, pretrained only on publicly accessible datasets, our model shows a 4. 6%p improvement compared to V-JEPA (ViT-L) and a 7. 7%p improvement compared to UMT (ViT-L).

item.title: biorecap: an R package for summarizing bioRxiv preprints with a local LLM
item.description: The establishment of bioRxiv facilitated the rapid adoption of preprints in the life sciences, accelerating the dissemination of new research findings.

item.title: Personality Alignment of Large Language Models
item.description: This dataset allows us to quantitatively evaluate the extent to which LLMs can align with each subject's behavioral patterns.

item.title: FedGS: Federated Gradient Scaling for Heterogeneous Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) in Deep Learning (DL)-automated medical image segmentation helps preserving privacy by enabling collaborative model training without sharing patient data.

item.title: The Vizier Gaussian Process Bandit Algorithm
item.description: Google Vizier has performed millions of optimizations and accelerated numerous research and production systems at Google, demonstrating the success of Bayesian optimization as a large-scale service.

item.title: Linear-time One-Class Classification with Repeated Element-wise Folding
item.description: This paper proposes an easy-to-use method for one-class classification: Repeated Element-wise Folding (REF).

item.title: AnyDesign: Versatile Area Fashion Editing via Mask-Free Diffusion
item.description: Moreover, these methods are limited in the variety of clothing types they can handle, as most datasets focus on people in clean backgrounds and only include generic garments such as tops, pants, and dresses.

item.title: First line of defense: A robust first layer mitigates adversarial attacks
item.description: We demonstrate that a carefully designed first layer of the neural network can serve as an implicit adversarial noise filter (ANF).

item.title: Positional Prompt Tuning for Efficient 3D Representation Learning
item.description: Together with the sequential Transformer, the whole module with position encoding comprehensively constructs a multi-scale feature abstraction module that considers both the local parts from the patch and the global parts from center points as position encoding.

item.title: KAN4TSF: Are KAN and KAN-based models Effective for Time Series Forecasting?
item.description: To this end, we introduce the Kolmogorov-Arnold Network (KAN) into time series forecasting research, which has better mathematical properties and interpretability.

item.title: GaussianOcc: Fully Self-supervised and Efficient 3D Occupancy Estimation with Gaussian Splatting
item.description: We propose Gaussian Splatting from Voxel space (GSV) to leverage the fast rendering properties of Gaussian splatting.

item.title: Improving Calibration by Relating Focal Loss, Temperature Scaling, and Properness
item.description: Thirdly, we propose focal temperature scaling - a new post-hoc calibration method combining focal calibration and temperature scaling.

item.title: Timeline and Boundary Guided Diffusion Network for Video Shadow Detection
item.description: Moreover, we are the first to introduce the Diffusion model for VSD in which we explore a Space-Time Encoded Embedding (STEE) to inject the temporal guidance for Diffusion to conduct shadow detection.

item.title: Pano2Room: Novel View Synthesis from a Single Indoor Panorama
item.description: The key idea is to initially construct a preliminary mesh from the input panorama, and iteratively refine this mesh using a panoramic RGBD inpainter while collecting photo-realistic 3D-consistent pseudo novel views.

item.title: Robust 3D Gaussian Splatting for Novel View Synthesis in Presence of Distractors
item.description: Our goal is to identify and ignore such distractors during the 3D Gaussian optimization to obtain a clean reconstruction.

item.title: SelfDRSC++: Self-Supervised Learning for Dual Reversed Rolling Shutter Correction
item.description: Subsequently, to effectively train the DRSC network, we propose a self-supervised learning strategy that ensures cycle consistency between input and reconstructed dual reversed RS images.

item.title: RAGLAB: A Modular and Research-Oriented Unified Framework for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Leveraging RAGLAB, we conduct a fair comparison of 6 RAG algorithms across 10 benchmarks.

item.title: RConE: Rough Cone Embedding for Multi-Hop Logical Query Answering on Multi-Modal Knowledge Graphs
item.description: However, to our knowledge, we are the first to introduce logical constructs in querying MMKGs and to answer queries that involve sub-entities of multi-modal entities as the answer.

item.title: Enhancing Cross-Modal Medical Image Segmentation through Compositionality
item.description: We introduce compositionality as an inductive bias in a cross-modal segmentation network to improve segmentation performance and interpretability while reducing complexity.

item.title: DABench: A Benchmark Dataset for Data-Driven Weather Data Assimilation
item.description: While researchers are exploring data-driven data assimilation (DA) models to generate accurate initial fields for LWMs, the lack of a standard benchmark impedes the fair evaluation among different data-driven DA algorithms.

item.title: Interpretable Long-term Action Quality Assessment
item.description: Long-term Action Quality Assessment (AQA) evaluates the execution of activities in videos.

item.title: EMO-LLaMA: Enhancing Facial Emotion Understanding with Instruction Tuning
item.description: However, current FER paradigms face challenges in generalization, lack semantic information aligned with natural language, and struggle to process both images and videos within a unified framework, making their application in multimodal emotion understanding and human-computer interaction difficult.

item.title: A Novel Evaluation Perspective on GNNs-based Recommender Systems through the Topology of the User-Item Graph
item.description: Recently, graph neural networks (GNNs)-based recommender systems have encountered great success in recommendation.

item.title: XDT-CXR: Investigating Cross-Disease Transferability in Zero-Shot Binary Classification of Chest X-Rays
item.description: This study explores the concept of cross-disease transferability (XDT) in medical imaging, focusing on the potential of binary classifiers trained on one disease to perform zero-shot classification on another disease affecting the same organ.

item.title: LAHAJA: A Robust Multi-accent Benchmark for Evaluating Hindi ASR Systems
item.description: Hindi, one of the most spoken language of India, exhibits a diverse array of accents due to its usage among individuals from diverse linguistic origins.

item.title: Revisiting FunnyBirds evaluation framework for prototypical parts networks
item.description: In this study, we comprehensively compare metric scores obtained for two types of ProtoPNet visualizations: bounding boxes and similarity maps.

item.title: Plug-in estimation of Schrödinger bridges
item.description: Instead, we show that the potentials obtained from solving the static entropic optimal transport problem between the source and target samples can be modified to yield a natural plug-in estimator of the time-dependent drift that defines the bridge between two measures.

item.title: MoE-LPR: Multilingual Extension of Large Language Models through Mixture-of-Experts with Language Priors Routing
item.description: Then, the model reviews the knowledge of the original languages with replay data amounting to less than 1% of post-pretraining, where we incorporate language priors routing to better recover the abilities of the original languages.

item.title: FATE: Focal-modulated Attention Encoder for Temperature Prediction
item.description: Our CCPD dataset also achieved a 24\% improvement in accuracy.

item.title: RePair: Automated Program Repair with Process-based Feedback
item.description: The gap between the trepidation of program reliability and the expense of repairs underscores the indispensability of Automated Program Repair (APR).

item.title: Great Memory, Shallow Reasoning: Limits of $k$NN-LMs
item.description: $K$-nearest neighbor language models ($k$NN-LMs), which integrate retrieval with next-word prediction, have demonstrated strong performance in language modeling as well as downstream NLP benchmarks.

item.title: Improving Query-by-Vocal Imitation with Contrastive Learning and Audio Pretraining
item.description: Query-by-Vocal Imitation (QBV) is about searching audio files within databases using vocal imitations created by the user's voice.

item.title: BearLLM: A Prior Knowledge-Enhanced Bearing Health Management Framework with Unified Vibration Signal Representation
item.description: This involves adaptively sampling the vibration signals based on the sampling rate of the sensor, incorporating the frequency domain to unify input dimensions, and using a fault-free reference signal as an auxiliary input.
